uh-huh

turns.text: And this year I decided that - well my husband made little garden out there with some tomatoes and stuff in it but I decided that I dont like grass I dont like to have to have to pull grass --

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

You know Ive seen lot of people that do that

turns.label: sd

Oh
turns.label: b

turns.text: Because she you know - they keep it warm with for all the older people and she keeps it year round
turns.label: sd

turns.text: I had never thought about that I could probably plant one and bring it in and just like I bring my plants in every year Thatd be neat Well I got patio and I tried to talk my husband into just buying whole bunch of pots And planting them all in it you know because thats favorite thing is tomatoes --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- to grow And so um but he said No he was going to plant in the earth you know like he always has because hes always had garden out in the country
uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: And I think he kind of misses it little bit you know since we moved to the city But um I went ahead and planted one and mine looks better than his It does and then I like um - you know what day lilies are
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Pardon me
turns.label: br

turns.text: Day lilies
turns.label: sd^r

turns.label: ny

turns.text: -- but we call them Morning Glories up here
turns.label: sd

turns.text: No no Huh-uh These look like lily They look like well they really look like an orchid when they come out
turns.label: ar

turns.text: Oh really
turns.label: b

turns.text: uh-huh That what the look like but they only bloom for one day
turns.label: b

turns.text: Oh
turns.label: b

turns.text: Theyll um - youll have bud the evening before and then the next morning as soon as the sun hits it it open- it starts opening up and then when it gets dark it closes and thats it It only blooms for one day
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And then its done completely done
turns.label: qy^d

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: ny

turns.text: Oh
turns.label: bk

turns.text: Yeah But um they look like orchids is what they look like but they look like different color ones like I have uh yellow ones and I have red ones and --
uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- I have purple ones and then they have like you know the real velvety looking stuff inside --
Oh yeah
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- it looks just like orchids in different colors Thats what they look like
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Oh really pretty
turns.label: ba

turns.text: They are theyre beautiful Uh I have friend when I lived out in the country and she had belonged to this kind of society that like every year you know or every so many months they would send you different bulbs that they came out with
turns.label: sv

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: And I mean they were real expensive They were like well - the most expensive one that she gave me bulb for was like thirty-two fifty for one bulb
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Oh my gosh
turns.label: ba

turns.text: So what she would do is she would plant them and they multiplied So the next year when she you know weeded them out --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- so they wouldnt be as thick then shed give me some of the bulbs And I mean I have some of the most beautiful day lilies that youve ever seen So when we decided to move it was really funny because like I said I had whole bunch of different kinds of things and I kept saying Well I want to take few of these and I want to take these and I want to take these My husband finally said Look are we going to take the grass Can we leave the grass I said Yes we may leave that
take the whole grass the whole yard
turns.label: bf

turns.text: And we had tree that was like seventeen foot tall or something like that that he said No no I am not taking the tree You know I mean every time we went outside hed look at something that was humongous you know No were not taking that But the last day he said Cant we leave the grass and I said Yeah I think we will leave that
turns.label: sd(^q)

turns.text: Thatd be funny
turns.label: ba

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

Yeah

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

Yeah

turns.text: So it wasnt like it was going to be this big raw place or something you know it would cover it right up
turns.label: sd

turns.text: uh-huh

uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- My husband does all that stuff But thats because Im allergic to the grass
turns.label: sd

turns.label: ba

turns.text: Really
turns.label: b

turns.label: b

turns.text: Yeah I used to until it I got so allergic to it I dont know if its all well - I went and had some tests run and just about all the kinds I was allergic to But its not as bad here like Saint Augustine I think is what we have And its not as bad as it was when we were out in the country
turns.label: b

turns.text: uh-huh
